p: Only a handful of studies have been carried out to investigate the bioactive potential of lower plants including bryophytes [ 13, 21, 22]. Since Sri Lanka is an isolated island with remarkable biodiversity among its flora, the density and the number of bryophyte species are very high. In this study, commonly available six bryophyte species were collected and authenticated as Marchantia sp., Fissidens sp., Plagiochila sp., S. demissum, H. cupressiforme, and C. motley. There are two liverworts ( Marchantia sp. and Plagiochila sp.), and the rest of bryophytes are mosses.
